title: Xyrus X. Maurer-Alcalá
text:
About Me
I am an Assistant Professor William & Mary whose research program integrates computational approaches with molecular biology to understand how eukaryotic diversification over deep time scales, origin of evolutoinarily “young” genes, molecular basis of adaptation, and how we can further “break” the textbook rules of life!
Here you’ll find information about my research, outreach and education activities, and my comprehensive lab notebook documenting ongoing projects and findings.

title: February Goals and Daily Entries
text:
February 2026 goals and daily notebook entries.





Finish eToL manuscript
Results for SAG-phylogenomics
Establish fundamental lab protocols





Build HMMs for EukPhylo datasets
Finish taxon selection for in-house work
Firmly establish microeukaryote cultures
Stare at “BAT”s for contamination and apicomplexan projects





Submit NSF PurSUiT





Develop personal website
Smooth out student semester goals and setup
Help students setup digital notebooks








HMM slides

title: Lab Notebook
text:
Welcome to my open lab notebook!
This is a cataloged and searchable collection of research notes and findings.

title: Lab Notebook
text:
How to Explore This Notebook

Search: Use the search box to find entries by keywords
Filter by Category: Click on categories to filter entries by project or topic
Sort: Sort entries by date, title, or other criteria
Browse: Scroll through all entries in chronological order
